title: Renew or replace your adult passport

details.description: How to renew your adult UK passport, how long it takes and choosing the best service to use
details.body:
You can renew or replace your UK adult passport up to 9 months before your current one runs out. It costs £72.50 by post or £81.25 through the Post Office’s Passport Check & Send service.

How long it takes to renew or replace a passport

It will take at least 3 weeks to get your passport - use a different service if you need your passport more urgently.

Renewals and replacements can take longer between April and September. Apply early whenever you can.

Time left on your existing passport will be added to your new one - up to a maximum of 9 months.

When to replace a damaged passport

If your passport is damaged and has more than reasonable wear and tear, you should replace it as soon as you can - you may not be allowed to travel with it.

Get the application form

If you’re in the UK, you can:

  • fill in the form online - the Identity and Passport Service (IPS) will post it back to you to check and sign
  • get one from a Post Office that offers the Passport Check & Send service
  • contact the Passport Adviceline and get them to post you one

Passport Adviceline

Email enquiry form
Telephone 0300 222 0000
Textphone 0300 222 0222
Text Relay 18001 0300 222 0000
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, Sunday and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm

If you’re outside the UK, you must apply a different way.

Help filling in the form

The form comes with notes to help you fill it in. You can also download a copy of the notes.

Download ‘Guidance notes - Applying for a passport’ (PDF, 495KB)

Photos

You must include 2 identical new photos of yourself.

Follow the rules about passport photos - your application may be delayed if your photos are rejected.

Countersignatories

You must get your application form and 1 of your photos signed by someone else to prove your identity if either:

  • you can’t be recognised from the photo in your existing passport
  • you’re replacing a damaged passport

Check who can countersign your application and photo and what they have to do.

Send your application

You can either:

  • use the Passport Check & Send service
  • post your application using the pre-printed envelope that comes with the form and include your existing passport, photos and supporting documents.

If you’re applying by post, you can either:

  • pay by debit or credit card by filling in the form in the application pack
  • send a cheque payable to ‘Identity and Passport Service’

What happens next

The IPS will check your application.

Your new passport will be sent to your home address by secure delivery - either by courier or Royal Mail Recorded Delivery.

If there’s no-one at home when the passport arrives, you’ll either be left a card or posted a letter explaining what happens next. The card or letter won’t mention that the package contains your passport.

Track your passport application

If you want to check your application’s progress, contact the Passport Adviceline - you can do this 2 weeks after you’ve made your application.

You need either:

  • the barcode number from your application form
  • the number on your receipt if you used Check & Send or applied at a Passport Customer Service Centre

Passport Adviceline

Email enquiry form
Telephone: 0300 222 0000
Textphone: 0300 222 0222
Text Relay: 18001 0300 222 0000
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, Sunday and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm
